title: New APP: Video player
body:
⚠️ These requirements are still in draft

<hr>

We need an upgrade to [this video player](http://assets.breatheco.de/apps/video/?v=ajax) 

Integrate with the Youtube Player API using React.js to augment the functionalities that come with the youtube player, focusing on education.

Videos tutorials will load from breathecode's the [vtutorial api](http://assets.breatheco.de/apis/vtutorial/).

These are the main feature it should have
- Play, pause, mute, control volume, jump ahead using the timeline.

- Fast forward (2x & 3x)

- Table of contents: Show a list of topics discussed in the video and be able to jump to that particular moment (you can get [that from the api](http://assets.breatheco.de/apis/vtutorial/ajax)).

- **Listen to Jump event from the website**: When the video is embeded in a website it can listen to a "jump_video" event and jump to the position the event information contains, this will be mainly used to click in a word in the video transcript and be able to jump to the moment in the video when that word was said.

- **Ask questions in a particular moment in the timeline** (commenting + questions): There needs to be a question/comment button tat when you press it its gets a timestamp from the video and the comment remains associated to that moment in time. If the comment is marked as a question teachers will be notified to reply.

- **Display playlist**: If the video is associated to a playlist, there should be a button to display the playlist.

title: QR Generation for LiveStreaming Classes
body:
We would like to use YI cameras to livestream the classes, here is how to generate the QR codes: https://cruxlab.com/blog/yi-camera-qr/

The idea will be to create a app that receives a wifi name, password and a cohort slug and it gets the live streaming URL from the assets.breatheco.de/apis/streaming apit and generates a QR for the teacher.

title: New API: BreatheCode Class Streaming
body:
We have to implement a small integration with StreamingVideoProvider.com as a streaming service for classes.

This are the api docs: https://docs.streamingvideoprovider.com/?shell#concept

This are the endpoints that need to be developed:

GET `stream/cohort/<cohort_slug>`
Needs to return all the videos that are in the cohort playlist on SVP.com.
It also needs to return the some other available information about the cohort streamings.

The API will have to first save the id of the playlist that its conected to that cohort, so that later it can retrieve videos for that particular cohort (playlist).

title: Traducción de quizzes al español
body:
En el siguiente directorio estan todos los quizzes de la academia, necesitamos duplicar el nombre del archivo y ponerle por ejemplo: `html.es.json` en lugar de `html.json` para el caso de español.

Los quiz en ingles se mantienen con el nombre en el que estan ya q es el lenguaje por defecto.

https://github.com/breatheco-de/assets/tree/master/apis/quiz/data

title: Replit-maker: Show the option for "Start from an empty Replit list" on the dropdown for cohorts
body:
If a cohort does not have previous replits and I want to "pre-load" from another cohort, we need the option to pre-load from an empty cohort in case I don't find any cohort that I like to pre-load from.

The option needs to say: "Load from an empty Replit list".

![screen shot 2019-02-18 at 2 41 26 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/426452/52973217-502b5a80-338b-11e9-9590-72ceffc9549f.png)

When choosed, the app shows all the inputs empty, for each of the replits the cohort is supposed to have:

![screen shot 2019-02-18 at 2 45 36 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/426452/52973379-ed868e80-338b-11e9-9046-4cecb6ae1275.png)

title: We need a script to remind students to complete their profile on breathecode
body:
We have to use the breathecode's API to get all the students of the cohorts that have not finished and check if they have already completed their profile information: first name, last name, github, if they are looking for a job, etc.

Here is the documentation on how to create a new reminder:
https://github.com/breatheco-de/assets/tree/master/apis/reminders#how-to-create-a-new-reminder

title: We need a reminder script that alerts if a cohort is missing its replits.
body:
### We need a reminder script that alerts if a cohort is missing the replits.

The replit's API is here: http://assets.breatheco.de/apis/replit/

You need to first get all the cohorts and then loop and check if they have replit's, Send an email if there are cohorts without replit's.

### Here is the documentation on how to create a new reminder:
https://github.com/breatheco-de/assets/tree/master/apis/reminders#how-to-create-a-new-reminder

title: New APP: Email Message Renderer
body:
This app will live under [https://assets.breatheco.de/apps/message](https://assets.breatheco.de/apps/message)

Using the [BreatheCode's Message API](https://assets.breatheco.de/apis/message/) we need an app that does the following:

- [ ] At first, it loads all the message types from the API and displays a dropdown to select what message type you want to see the email template from.
- [ ] after the user selects one of the message types, it displays the HTML email template of that message with some sample data.

Note: the interface should be similar to the Repl.it Maker or the Event Checking App.

title: Create a PDF certificate for students on-demand
body:
This is an example of one of the certificates the academy gives to the students on completion of any course:
![screen shot 2018-12-18 at 12 48 33 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/426452/50173897-be3d9d80-02c6-11e9-8bcd-660c30c216ff.png)


First you would need to building the HTML based on 2 variables:
- **The cohort slug**: You will use it to get the cohort name, the course name, the graduation date and the total hours completed and the teacher signature.
- **The Student ID**: You will use it to get the student name.

Note: you can get all the information using the [BreatheCode's API](https://github.com/breatheco-de/api).

After the HTML looks amazing work on generating the PDF on the client-side using [this library jsPDF](https://github.com/MrRio/jsPDF) or [this library with react.js](https://medium.com/@shivekkhurana/how-to-create-pdfs-from-react-components-client-side-solution-7f506d9dfa6d) or any other library you may like.

In the end, the application should receive the Student ID and the Cohort Slug and that should be enough to generate and visualize a PDF with the student certificate, the URL can be something like this:
```
https://cert.breatheco.de/student/:student_id/cohort/:cohort_slug
```

### Important

If the student has not graduated or did not complete the program the certificate will not be generated, an 404 error will be shown on the screen. You can know if a student has graduated from the BreatheCode's API.

title: Create a quiz about building API's with django and django-rest.
body:
We need a quiz about `Building APIs using django and djangorest` so that students can auto-grade themselves in terms of their knowledge.

This lesson will help you get inspired:
https://breatheco.de/en/lesson/building-restful-apis-with-django/

You can read issue #30 to understand how to build a quiz.

At least 15 questions. Try to make students think and not just answer by memory.

title: Replit-Maker: On the list that shows the cohorts, include status to see if the cohort already has replits created
body:
If would save a lot of time if before choosing a cohort I could know if that cohort already has exercises or not.

![screen shot 2018-11-02 at 4 59 47 pm](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/426452/47940362-c54c5000-dec0-11e8-8c23-e6c254e3249c.png)

It could be as simple as displaying the name of the cohort and in parenthesis the status, for example:

Downtown II 
Downtown IV (no previous exercises)
Downtown V

The cohort `Downtown II` has not replits yet.

title: Update the react-hello boilerplate to implement a "one command deploy" to surge.sh
body:
[This is the current React-Hello boilerplate](https://github.com/4GeeksAcademy/react-hello) that 4Geeks Academy students follow when they want to start a new project in react.js.

Right now, the boilerplate already comes with integration to GitHub pages allowing you to deploy your website for free in just one command by typing:
```
$ npm run deploy
```
It will be nice to have a similar way to deploy to surge, by typing:
```
$ npm run deploy-surge
```

To complete this issue you have to fork and clone [this repository](https://github.com/4GeeksAcademy/react-hello) and implement your one-command-deploy script very similar to how the [deploy-to-github ](https://github.com/4GeeksAcademy/react-hello/blob/master/deploy-to-github.js) script was made, and then add it to the package.json scripts property.

```json
	"scripts": {
		"c9": "webpack-dev-server --mode development --open --host $IP --port $PORT",
		"dev-server": "webpack-dev-server --mode development --hot",
		"build": "webpack --mode development",
		"deploy": "node deploy-to-github.js"
	},
```

One you finish and test your development you can push to your forked repo and then pull request to the original.
